channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens
item.description: We introduce the Byte Latent Transformer (BLT), a new byte-level LLM architecture that, for the first time, matches tokenization-based LLM performance at scale with significant improvements in inference efficiency and robustness.

item.title: Large Concept Models: Language Modeling in a Sentence Representation Space
item.description: In this paper, we present an attempt at an architecture which operates on an explicit higher-level semantic representation, which we name a concept.

item.title: Learning Flow Fields in Attention for Controllable Person Image Generation
item.description: Additionally, we show that our loss is model-agnostic and can be used to improve the performance of other diffusion models.

item.title: DeepSeek-VL2: Mixture-of-Experts Vision-Language Models for Advanced Multimodal Understanding
item.description: We present DeepSeek-VL2, an advanced series of large Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) Vision-Language Models that significantly improves upon its predecessor, DeepSeek-VL, through two key major upgrades.

item.title: Gaze-LLE: Gaze Target Estimation via Large-Scale Learned Encoders
item.description: We address the problem of gaze target estimation, which aims to predict where a person is looking in a scene.

item.title: Causal Diffusion Transformers for Generative Modeling
item.description: We introduce Causal Diffusion as the autoregressive (AR) counterpart of Diffusion models.

item.title: Arbitrary-steps Image Super-resolution via Diffusion Inversion
item.description: This study presents a new image super-resolution (SR) technique based on diffusion inversion, aiming at harnessing the rich image priors encapsulated in large pre-trained diffusion models to improve SR performance.

item.title: FunAudioLLM: Voice Understanding and Generation Foundation Models for Natural Interaction Between Humans and LLMs
item.description: This report introduces FunAudioLLM, a model family designed to enhance natural voice interactions between humans and large language models (LLMs).

item.title: An Evolved Universal Transformer Memory
item.description: Prior methods propose to offset the escalating costs of modern foundation models by dropping specific parts of their contexts with hand-designed rules, while attempting to preserve their original performance.

item.title: EasyVolcap: Accelerating Neural Volumetric Video Research
item.description: Volumetric video is a technology that digitally records dynamic events such as artistic performances, sporting events, and remote conversations.

item.title: Video Seal: Open and Efficient Video Watermarking
item.description: To reduce these gaps, this paper introduces Video Seal, a comprehensive framework for neural video watermarking and a competitive open-sourced model.

item.title: SLAM3R: Real-Time Dense Scene Reconstruction from Monocular RGB Videos
item.description: In this paper, we introduce \textbf{SLAM3R}, a novel and effective monocular RGB SLAM system for real-time and high-quality dense 3D reconstruction.

item.title: Lyra: An Efficient and Speech-Centric Framework for Omni-Cognition
item.description: As Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) evolve, expanding beyond single-domain capabilities is essential to meet the demands for more versatile and efficient AI.

item.title: Docling Technical Report
item.description: This technical report introduces Docling, an easy to use, self-contained, MIT-licensed open-source package for PDF document conversion.

item.title: HelloMeme: Integrating Spatial Knitting Attentions to Embed High-Level and Fidelity-Rich Conditions in Diffusion Models
item.description: We propose an effective method for inserting adapters into text-to-image foundation models, which enables the execution of complex downstream tasks while preserving the generalization ability of the base model.

item.title: StableAnimator: High-Quality Identity-Preserving Human Image Animation
item.description: During inference, we propose a novel Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman (HJB) equation-based optimization to further enhance the face quality.

item.title: FireFlow: Fast Inversion of Rectified Flow for Image Semantic Editing
item.description: Though Rectified Flows (ReFlows) with distillation offers a promising way for fast sampling, its fast inversion transforms images back to structured noise for recovery and following editing remains unsolved.

item.title: Best-of-N Jailbreaking
item.description: We find that BoN Jailbreaking achieves high attack success rates (ASRs) on closed-source language models, such as 89% on GPT-4o and 78% on Claude 3. 5 Sonnet when sampling 10, 000 augmented prompts.

item.title: Representing Long Volumetric Video with Temporal Gaussian Hierarchy
item.description: In addition, the tree-like structure of the Gaussian hierarchy allows us to efficiently represent the scene at a particular moment with a subset of Gaussian primitives, leading to nearly constant GPU memory usage during the training or rendering regardless of the video length.

item.title: LLMs-as-Judges: A Comprehensive Survey on LLM-based Evaluation Methods
item.description: Finally, we provide a detailed analysis of the limitations of LLM judges and discuss potential future directions.
